meanings.definition: A person or thing that precedes or comes before; forerunner
meanings.sent1: The bright morning star acted as a herald of the coming sunrise.
meanings.sent2: The robin's song heralds the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The early blooming flowers were the heralds of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of thunder heralds an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The first snowflake falling heralds the start of winter.

meanings.definition: A person who announces important news or events
meanings.sent1: The town crier was the herald who announced the king's decree.
meanings.sent2: The journalist heralds breaking news to the public.
meanings.sent3: The excited child acted as a herald, announcing the arrival of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock heralds the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The announcer heralds the winner of the competition.

meanings.definition: To proclaim or announce with or as if with a herald
meanings.sent1: The trumpets herald the arrival of the royal procession.
meanings.sent2: The ringing bells herald the beginning of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The loudspeaker heralds the start of the event with a cheerful announcement.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the sunset herald the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The drumbeats herald the start of the parade.
